results.title: Urban poetics
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
An abstract visual narrative about 21st century modern living and the absurdity of life. Themes of urban sprawl, desolation, commercialism and the mundanity of routine and the ordinary are all explored in this short film.

results.title: Attack of the strange insects from Uranus
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This mockumentary, depicting the zombie apocalypse, contains a hilarious collection of violence and gore. (Note that some scenes may disturb some viewers).

results.title: Pavor nocturnus
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
An abstract narrative about dream flashbacks of a disturbing nature. A child survives a car accident in which his father was killed. He has contiinuing mental flashbacks and consequently this makes him fear death. He is bitten on the arm by a fly, and this begins a surreal experience of messages being relayed to him via the fly bites. A surreal thriller where confusion between the dream self and the real self is explored.

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (March 2007)
results.creator_credit: Sue Silk, Sonya Waters, Sally McCutcheon, Martin Zerfas, Lyn McLeavy, Louise Blake, Llywellyn Staiff, Joyce Evans, Edwin Whiting, Christine Lamb, Alfred Zerfas, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eleven stories from members of the general public. Mostly autobiographical, they are stories that concern themselves mostly with the passions of the creator, whether social issues, history, hobbies or family. These passions and interests are what makes the participants who they are.

results.title: Why plant millions of trees
results.creator_credit: Alfred Zerfas, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Alfred Zerfas gives background to and outlines the achievements of Social Education and Development Society (SEDS). This organisation was started in the 1980s in response to the crushing effects of drought in Southern India. With persistance over the decades, the work of SEDS, in collaboration with the communities they support, has brought about economic, social and enviromental change in these communities with lasting benefits.

results.title: Genre
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A day in the life of a blocked screenwriter. A film producer is harassing a screenwriter who is suffering major problems trying to come up with a script for his next movie. This short film visually depicts the film scenarios this writer conjures up - a mystery and gangster style thriller. Neither of these stories satisfy the frustrated screenwriter, and so he ends up writing a simple love story between two ordinary people. Finally he finishes the script and rushes to the post box to send his script to the producer. Upon arriving at the letter box, he meets the woman of his dreams. His screenwriting dreams become a reality.
